article_title: Moving (And Keeping) Patients Out of Hospitals And Nursing Homes

article_metadata.description: One of the greatest frustrations in health care is that technology tends to drive up costs. In pretty much every other area of our lives, technology reduces costs. Increased health spending is associated with better health outcomes. Nevertheless, we would like to get these benefits at less cost. The opportunity to achieve this is at hand. A host of technologies promises to significantly reduce costs by eliminating friction in the flow of clinical data between providers and patients, making sense of data from different sources, and allowing patients and providers to interact in new, cost-effective ways.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
